alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County; North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 3:29AM PST until January 18 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Wet snow expected above 2500 feet. Total snow accumulations 3-6 inches, except for up to 8 inches on Sawyers Bar Road west of Etna. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County, Central Siskiyou County, South Central Siskiyou County and North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County. This includes portions of I-5, including Black Butte Summit, and Highway 89 including Snowman Summit. * WHEN...From 10 AM to 10 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow may begin before 10 am pdt Wednesday, however most of the snow accumulation is expected from 10 am pdt until 8 pm pdt. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Central Siskiyou County; North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County
